acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on LD50 values of 1.41 mL/kg (1791 mg/kg) (male) and 0.84 mL/kg (1067 mg/kg) (female) for rabbits (RTECS (2008), the original literature: Journal of the American College of Toxicology, Part B. (Mary Ann Liebert, Inc., 1651 Third Ave., New York, NY 10128) 12, 571 (1993)), the substance was classified into Category 4.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data. As relevant information, there is information of LC50 values for rats: 404 ppm (GESTIS (access on Aug. 2009) and 450 ppm (RTECS (2008)). Since the LC50 value was lower than 90% of saturated vapour pressure concentration (219,737 ppm), the test was considered to be conducted for vapour with almost no included mists.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on a LD50 value of 0.8 g/kg bw for rats (PATTY (5th, 2001)), the substance was classified into Category 4.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: No data available. Information is available that the substance is corrosive and combustible liquid and corrodes many metals (Hommel (1996)).

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified into Category 2 since flash point -15 degC (closed-cup) (IUCLID (2000)) is <23 degC and initial boiling point 47.8 degC (Howard (1997)) is >35 degC. The substance is classified into Class 3, UN Subsidiary risk 8, PG II in UNRTDG (UN1250).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative results in intraperitoneal injection male rat dominant lethal test (in vivo heritable germ cell mutagenicity tests) and bone marrow chromosomal aberration test (in vivo somatic cell mutagenicity tests) (HSDB (2007)), the substance was classified as "Not classified". As relevant information, from in vitro mutagenicity test, there are reports of a negative Ames test (HSDB (2007)) and a negative mouse lymphoma cells chromosomal aberration test (HSDB (2007)).

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Auto-ignition point is 404 degC (Hommel (1996)), 490 degC (ICSC (2002)) exceeding 70 degC.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on a result of "severe damage" in a rabbit test (HSDB (2007)) and a report of "causes severe eye burns" as a human health effect (HSDB (2007)), the substance was classified into Category 1. As relevant information, in EU classification, the substance is classified into Xi; R36/37/38 (EU-Annex I (access on Aug. 2009)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on a result of "corrosive" in a rabbit test (IUCLID (2000)) and "causes severe skin burns" as a human health effects (HSDB (2007)), the substance was classified into Category 1. As relevant information, in EU classification, the substance is classified into Xi: R36/37/38 (EU-Annex I (access on Aug. 2009)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Classified into Not classified since the substance is classified into Class 3, Subsidiary risk 8, PG II in UNRTDG (UN1250) though it contains metalloids (Si), further the substance decomposes on contact with water and gas formed is hydrogen chloride (IMDG Code) and not combustible gas.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on reports that the substance is "Irritating to skin, eyes, and respiratory system. Inhalation cause burning sensation, cough, sore throat, and labored breathing. Symptoms may be delayed" (HSDB (2007)) and classification into Xi; R36/37/38 in EU classification, the substance was classified into Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation).
